metadata.title: CVE-2021-47089 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: kfence:fix memory leak when cat kfence objects Hulk robot reported a kmemleakproblem: unreferenced object 0xffff93d1d8cc02e8 (size 248): comm "cat", pid23327, jiffies 4624670141 (age 495992.217s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): 0040 85 19 d4 93 ff ff 00 10 00 00 00 00 00 00 .@.............. 00 00 00 0000 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 ................ backtrace:seq_open+0x2a/0x80 full_proxy_open+0x167/0x1e0 do_dentry_open+0x1e1/0x3a0path_openat+0x961/0xa20 do_filp_open+0xae/0x120 do_sys_openat2+0x216/0x2f0do_sys_open+0x57/0x80 do_syscall_64+0x33/0x40entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xa9 unreferenced object0xffff93d419854000 (size 4096): comm "cat", pid 23327, jiffies 4624670141(age 495992.217s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): 6b 66 65 6e 63 65 2d 23 32 3530 3a 20 30 78 30 kfence-#250: 0x0 30 30 30 30 30 30 30 37 35 34 62 64 6131 32 2d 0000000754bda12- backtrace: seq_read_iter+0x313/0x440seq_read+0x14b/0x1a0 full_proxy_read+0x56/0x80 vfs_read+0xa5/0x1b0ksys_read+0xa0/0xf0 do_syscall_64+0x33/0x40entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xa9 I find that we can easilyreproduce this problem with the following commands: cat/sys/kernel/debug/kfence/objects echo scan > /sys/kernel/debug/kmemleak cat/sys/kernel/debug/kmemleak The leaked memory is allocated in the stackbelow: do_syscall_64 do_sys_open do_dentry_open full_proxy_open seq_open---> alloc seq_file vfs_read full_proxy_read seq_read seq_read_itertraverse ---> alloc seq_buf And it should have been released in thefollowing process: do_syscall_64 syscall_exit_to_user_modeexit_to_user_mode_prepare task_work_run ____fput __fput full_proxy_release---> free here However, the release function corresponding tofile_operations is not implemented in kfence. As a result, a memory leakoccurs. Therefore, the solution to this problem is to implement thecorresponding release function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47089` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
